questions.question: In the RRT algorithm, The Extend operation
answers: a. expnads the tree and advances the motion towards q_goal
b. expands the tree and advances the motion towards q_goal and q_init
c. expnads the tree and tries to build a new branch q_goal

questions.question: Considering the following state vector and covariance matrix (stohastic map) of an EKF-SLAM system
answers: a. robot pose covariance matrix and the covariance matrices of respective landmarks
b. cross-covariance matrices between the landmarks and the robot's pose
c. robot pose covariance matrices in the consecutive time moments(along the trajectory

questions.question: The RRT* algorithm
answers: a. is complete and optimal, in opposition to the classic RRT
b. is asymptotically optimal and fast exploration properties like RRT
c. is complete, but not optimal

questions.question: Considering a trilateration localization procedure (measuring distances is possible) in 2D navigation of a mobile robot, how many landmarks have to be in the field of view to compute the robot's position?
answers: a. two landmarks
b. three landmarks not creating a straight line
c. three landmarks

questions.question: Probabilistic RoadMaps(PRM)
answers: a. is a motion planning method designed for car-like vehicles
b. is a method designed mainly for motion planning problems with multiple queries (multi-query)
c. is a method designed mainly for motion planning problems with single queries (single-query)

questions.question: The local minima problem in the potential fields motion planning method can be solved
answers: a. assigning to each obstacle the direction of motion of the robot near it (spin)
b. ensuring equal distribution of the potential on the obstacles
c. assigning to the robot a large enough positive potential

questions.question: Which one of the following statements is FALSE
answers: a. The paths planned using visibility graph may be incident to the vertices of the polygonal obstacles
b. The Voronoi graph method produces shorter paths than the visibility graph method
c. Paths created with the Voronoi graph method tend to keep equal distances to the neighboring obstacles

questions.question: How many actuators (independent motors) does need the robot shown in this figure to be omnidirectional (holonomic)
answers: a. two, on the opposite sides
b. four, one per wheel
c. a single motor with driving belts

questions.question: In motion planning, resolution completeness
answers: a. guarantees that the planning algorithm finds a path if the resolution of the grid map is large enough (large cells)
b. guarantees that the planning algorithm finds a path if the resolution of the grid map is large enough (small cells)
c. guarantees that the planning algorithm finds a path if the resolution of the grid map is small enough, ensuring tractable computations.

questions.question: In a particle filter, the probability distribution (PDF) is represented
answers: a. alternatively by the density of particles (samples) or the weights of these particles
b. alternatively by the importance of particles or the weights of these particles
c. by the number of particles within a given area

questions.question: In a typical EKF-SLAM implementation with non-unique landmarks (i.e. landmarks that cannot be easily "read" by the sensor for their ID) the predictions and observations are matched using
answers: a. a probabilistic method applying Bayes filter
b. using Hamming distance
c. a probabilistic method with Mahalanobis distance

questions.question: Sampling-based motion planning algorithms
answers: a. preserve some form of completeness, such as probabilistic completeness or completeness with respect to resolution
b. are completer, but cannot be optimal
c. by construction are neither complete nor optimal

questions.question: In a car-like kinematic robot(four wheels) the turning radius depends of
answers: a. the distance between the axes and the steering wheels maximum deflection angle
b. the wheels basis(width) and the steering wheels maximum deflection angle
c. the steering wheels maximum deflection angle

questions.question: In RRT algorithm
answers: a. represents an obstacle in C_free
b. represents a plausible next move of the robot
c. represents a configuration of the robot

questions.question: In robotics, dead reckoning
answers: a. is a procedure that detects dead ends in motion planning
b. determines the pose of a (mobile) robot using a fixed (dead) map of the environment
c. determines the current position of a given vehicle (mobile robot) on the basis of its previous position, known course and speed, and travel time

questions.question: In a hierarchival navigation system
answers: a. a symbolic model of the environment is used as a central structure
b. no environment model is necessary, because all knowledge is rule-based

questions.question: A robot can be defined as
answers: a. a software agent that is intended for specific hardware
b. a physical agent that performs tasks by manipulating the physical world
c. an agent that can perform useful tasks

questions.question: A planning algorithm is complete if
answers: a. in finite time it either finds a solution or correctly reports that theres is no solution
b. in finite time it finds optimal solution or correctly reports that theres is no solution
c. it guarantees a high probability of finding a solution or reporting that theres is no solution

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a family motion planning methods
answers: a. roadside following
b. cell decomposition
c. wavefront

questions.question: In hierarchical control system of a robot
answers: a. all modules are divided into layers with a strictly defned hierarchy. Layers occupying a higher level in the hierarchy, define a task and send it to lower, subordinate levels
b. modules are divided into layers with a strictly defned hierarchy. Layers occupying a higher level in the hierarchy perform more important tasks
c. all modules are equal in the hierarchy

questions.question: Which of the following issues in a differential-drive mobile robot odometry causes systematic errors
answers: a. differences in diameter of driving wheels (e.g. due to tyre wear)
b. external forces, e.g. causes by a jammed caster wheel
c. bumps and/or potholes on the surface

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the PRM motion planning algorithm is FALSE
answers: a. in PRM the solution is obtained by querying the shortest path using Dijkstra's algorithm
b. PRM is probabilistically complete, assuming certain conditions on the shape of the free space
c. PRM is a complete algorithm

questions.question: An approximate cell decomposition in 2D motion planning have adaptive cell size
answers: a. using a quadtree data structure
b. using an octree data structure
c. using a binary tree

questions.question: This scheme shows a mobile robot configuration of the type
answers: a. synchro drive
b. tricycle drive
c. differential drive

questions.question: In the PRM planning algorithm, the rate of convergence depends on
answers: a. the number of actions undertaken by the local planner
b. the visibility property of the free space, where the visibility is determined by the local planner
c. the average distance between the points sampled from the configuration space

questions.question: The figure shows
answers: a. pose graph (pose-based SLAM)
b. EKF-SLAM
c. full bundle adjustment SLAM

questions.question: Probabilistic completeness in motion planning
answers: a. ensures that the probability of reaching the stop condition of the planning algorithm approaches one
b. ensures that as more actions are performed, the probability that the planner will find an optimal path, asymptotically approaches one
c. ensures that as more actions are performed, the probability that the planner will not find path, if one exists, asymptotically approaches zero

questions.question: In a particle filter the "importance sampling" procedure
answers: a. assigning weights to particles upon a sensory observation
b. increases the number of particles when necessary
c. removes unnecessary particles

questions.question: The configuration space of a robot is reffered to as
answers: a. the space C of all configuratoins of this robot
b. the spcae C_free of all possible collision-free configurations
c. a space enumerating all degrees of freedom (DoF) of the robot

questions.question: In the FastSLAM algorithm
answers: a. the poses of the robot and landmarks are estimated using non-linear optimization
b. the robot's trajectory is estimated by a particle filter, while the landmarks are considered independent and their poses are estimated by individual extended Kalman filters
c. the robot and the landmarks are considered independent and their poses are estimated by individual extended Kalman filters
